Text.Language: Amwini t/rou n~tenhwc: ouoh n~tener'alin e~Po#c#: I/#c# P,#c# pilogoc: v/e~taftounoc n~Lazaroc.
Come all together, to praise and sing to the Lord, Jesus Christ the Word, who raised Lazarus.

Bon niben ce]w~ou nak: w~ Pis/ri n~Aidioc: ouoh piw~ou f~ersau nak: je aktounoc n~Lazaroc.
Everyone glorifies You, O eternal Son, and You are worthy of the glory, for You have raised Lazarus.

For truly Lazarus was dead, and they buried him in the tomb, and after four days, Jesus raised him.

When the righteous Martha learned, of the coming of our Lord Jesus, she cried saying "If You were here, Lazarus my brother would not have died."

To You the glory and the praise, O good Lover of Mankind, with Your power raise us, like Lazarus the righteous.

And after that she came back, to her sister saying, "Our Teacher the Christ has come, to comfort us for Lazarus.

Who is like You among the gods, O our good Savior, with the power of Your divinity, You raised Lazarus the righteous.
